verses.roman:
aṇur bṛhat kṛśaḥ sthūlo
yo yo bhāvaḥ prasidhyati
sarvo 'py ubhaya-saṁyuktaḥ
prakṛtyā puruṣeṇa ca

synonyms: aṇuḥ—small; bṛhat—great; kṛśaḥ—thin; sthūlaḥ—stout; yaḥ yaḥ—whatever; bhāvaḥ—manifestation; prasidhyati—is established; sarvaḥ—all; api—indeed; ubhaya—by both; saṁyuktaḥ—conjoined; prakṛtyā—by nature; puruṣeṇa—by the enjoying spirit soul; ca—and.
translation: Whatever features visibly exist within this world—small or great, thin or stout—certainly contain both the material nature and its enjoyer, the spirit soul.
